column4: i'm having trouble with the live installer for 9.04; i put it on a usb stick and it worked the first time, but now it won't start the live distro or the install at all - i can't tell what's happening because usplash or whatever it is hides everything - the only signal i get that something is wrong is the progress bar stops 'night rider'ing and my caps lock light flashes - any ideas what this
means?
When you are looking at the menu you can hit F6 (I think) to get to alternative options.  Remove the word "quite" and the word "splash" to see what is going on behind the scenes :)
When you are at the menu you can press F6 to set kernel options.  Do you know what I'm talking about?
no
Is this off a CD or usb?
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/GraphicalInstall?action=AttachFile&do=get&target=Install2StartUp.png  not like this anymore?  See the F4 option?
if you press escape at that menu; it loads a simplified one. that's all i get now.
So you do see the menu I screen-shotted?
Can you get a screen-shot of the simplified one?  Maybe google image search it?
I don't think I've ever seen it

I don't have a live CD.  Is there anyway to set kernel options in this menu?  Have you scoward the whole thing?  What you need to do is turn off the splash and quiet options so that you can see the errors during your boot.
I'm sorry I didn't see that *sheepish*
Then I suggest you check the filesystem of the usb stick.  Do you have a working ubuntu install or a live CD ?
this worked the first time, and i've re-imaged and integrity checked the live on the usb stick a couple of times to make sure it's fine
That is strange.  Do you have faulty hardware somewhere in your machine?  i know that live CD's won't boot if you have a fried network card or something.
no it does this on every machine i put the stick in
I have no idea.  Perhaps the stick is physically damaged?
Sorry I'm not more help :(
surely the integrity check (md5 on each file) suggests there's no damage?
It was just a shot in the dark.  a good md5 checksum does seem to mean the disk is fine.  Like I said. I don't know what the issue could be :(
lol after re-imaging again this time i didn't even see a boot menu at all, it was entirely replaced by unetbootin's own implementation, and it booted right away! what the fffffffff?
Maybe a bug in unetbootin?  I have no clue
